page.title: 01REVIEW OF MORFA BYCHAN
page.content: Morfa Bychan,"The Small Marsh",is one of the popular holiday resorts of North Wales because of its two miles of wide sandy beach and beautiful views.Situated at the North-East corner of Cardigan Bay,it enjoys a mild winter.It has grown from a small, scattered farming community to a rapidly-increasing population of about 425.The main road from Porthmadog climbs a hill giving striking views of sea and mountains before descending to the flat area by the sea,and continues through the village to the Black Rock end of the beach.A minor road climbs past Treflys Church and joins the A497 There is a bus service,not much used as most residents travel by car,to Porthmadog where there are shops and the railway station.
